sharepointapp

Class SharePointMainController

  • java.lang.Object
    • sharepointapp.SharePointMainController

  • public class SharePointMainController
extends java.lang.Object
    This is the class responsible for communicating between the different views and for managing different processes. This allows the ListView, ItemView, ToolbarView, and Web Controller to exist without knowing about each other.
    Author:
    allarj3

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void clearMessages()
      Clears the messages from the different views.
      void connectToSite(java.lang.String url)
      Connects the views to a specific site
      void displayMessages(java.lang.String toolbarMessage, java.lang.String itemViewMessage, boolean isSuccessful)
      Displays error messages to the different views.
      void finishedConnectingToSite(java.util.List<java.lang.String> allLists, java.lang.String listToLoad)
      This is called when the web controller is done loading a site and it will then pass the lists to the list view.
      java.util.List<java.lang.String> getCurrentItemPaths()
      Gets the current paths selected in the items view.
      java.lang.String getCurrentList()
      Returns the current list's name
      static SharePointMainController getInstance()
      Returns the MainController instance that everything uses.
      void initialize()
      Because of concurrency issues, the main controller needs to be initialized after all of the other views and controllers are created.
      void setCurrentList(java.lang.String listName)
      Sets the current list's name
      void setFilesDownloadable(boolean areDownloadble)
      Is used to state that selected items can be downloaded
      void updateItems()
      Updates the list of items to view.

    • Method Detail

      • getInstance

        public static SharePointMainController getInstance()
        Returns the MainController instance that everything uses.
        Returns:

      • initialize

        public void initialize()
        Because of concurrency issues, the main controller needs to be initialized after all of the other views and controllers are created. This must be called before any functions cna run on the main controller, though.

      • connectToSite

        public void connectToSite(java.lang.String url)
        Connects the views to a specific site
        Parameters:
        url - - the site to connect to

      • finishedConnectingToSite

        public void finishedConnectingToSite(java.util.List<java.lang.String> allLists,
                                     java.lang.String listToLoad)
        This is called when the web controller is done loading a site and it will then pass the lists to the list view.
        Parameters:
        allLists - - the lists that the web controller loaded from the server
        listToLoad - - the list to load, if one was specified during a refresh. It will be null when loading a new site.

      • updateItems

        public void updateItems()
        Updates the list of items to view.

      • displayMessages

        public void displayMessages(java.lang.String toolbarMessage,
                            java.lang.String itemViewMessage,
                            boolean isSuccessful)
        Displays error messages to the different views.
        Parameters:
        toolbarMessage - - the message to display on the tool bar.
        itemViewMessage - - the message to display in the items view
        isSuccessful - - used to indicate if the message was concerned with an error or a success

      • clearMessages

        public void clearMessages()
        Clears the messages from the different views.

      • getCurrentItemPaths

        public java.util.List<java.lang.String> getCurrentItemPaths()
        Gets the current paths selected in the items view.
        Returns:
        The list of items paths in string form

      • setFilesDownloadable

        public void setFilesDownloadable(boolean areDownloadble)
        Is used to state that selected items can be downloaded
        Parameters:
        areDownloadble - - the value to set it to

      • getCurrentList

        public java.lang.String getCurrentList()
        Returns the current list's name
        Returns:
        the list

      • setCurrentList

        public void setCurrentList(java.lang.String listName)
        Sets the current list's name
        Parameters:
        listName - - the list to make current
